title: Meka Chakra Rao vs. State of Andhra Pradesh
summary: Supreme Court clarifies that market value for acquired land must consider potentiality of development, not just current agricultural use. Crucial for land pooling schemes in AP.

title: K. Srinivas vs. Spl. Deputy Collector
summary: Mutation entries in revenue records (1B) do not confer title but are strong evidence of possession. RDO cannot cancel pattas without following due process under ROR Act.

title: State of AP vs. V. Ramana
summary: Automatic arrest in 498A (Dowry Harassment) cases is violative of Arnesh Kumar guidelines. Police officers must serve Section 41A CrPC notice before arrest.

title: Lakshmi Narayana vs. Authorized Officer
summary: Land Grabbing Tribunal has jurisdiction only when strict proof of 'grabbing' is evident. Mere boundary disputes must be settled in Civil Courts.

title: P. Ravi Kumar vs. District Collector, Anantapur
summary: District Collector cannot arbitrarily place private patta lands in Section 22A (Prohibited List) without specific government orders. Registrar directed to register sale deed.

title: S. Naresh vs. State of AP
summary: Mandamus issued directing Tahsildar to dispose of online F-Line petition for survey and boundary fixation within 45 days. Inaction leading to contempt.

title: Union of India vs. Raj Gopal
summary: Departmental enquiry cannot be initiated on vague charges. Findings must be based on evidence, not suspicion. Reinstatement with back wages ordered.

title: G. Venkata Reddy vs. Joint Collector
summary: Occupant of Inam land entitled to Ryotwari Patta under Inams Abolition Act if possession proved prior to 1948. Joint Collector order set aside.

title: State Bank vs. T. Ramesh
summary: In Section 138 cases, presumption of debt exists. Burden of proof shifts to accused to show non-existence of debt. Conviction upheld.
